data.title: Modern Family
data.text:
Broadway Ball Game

Take Me Out Stars Jesse Tyler Ferguson and Jesse Williams on the Long-Game Beauty of the Hit Revival

“I'll never experience this as an actor again, I guarantee you,” Jesse Tyler Ferguson said of acting in the Tony-winning Broadway show for a second time with his costar Jesse Williams.

A new comedy from Modern Family’s creator is stuck between skewering old school sitcoms and missing them desperately.

From the Magazine

Can Abbott Elementary Lead a Network-Comedy Resurgence at the Emmys?

It’s been nearly a decade since a network show won the Emmy for best comedy—but the pendulum may be ready to swing back.

The couple wed over the weekend at a winery near Santa Barbara, California.

From the Magazine

Saying Goodbye: 13 TV Shows Make an Exit

Meghan Markle’s old day job Suits is just one of many series moving into the great streaming library in the sky. To all of them, V.F. says: Thank you for your service, and see you in the good place.

Remembering Fred Willard, Who Stood Out by Being a Team Player

A tribute to the ubiquitous funnyman, a comedy great as generous as he was singular.

The long-running series concluded with a simple finale that set the stage for more.
